jmortgage.payment.extra
Interface ExtraPmt

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultExtraPmt
public interface ExtraPmt

Implementations of this interface encapsulate extra payments. Extra payment objects contain the amount of the extra payment, the number of payments to which the extra payment will be applied, and a PmtKey object. The PmtKey object indicates the start date of the extra payment. This start date must match exactly with the date of one of the regular mortgage payments. The PmtKey also indicates the interval of the extra payment. Valid interval values are Onetime, Yearly, Monthly, Biweekly, and Weekly.

Since:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

Method Detail

getPmtKey

PmtKey getPmtKey()
Gets the PmtKey object for this extra payment. The PmtKey object indicates the start date of the extra payment and the interval between extra payments.

Returns:
PmtKey instantiation

getCount

int getCount()
Gets the number of consecutive times to apply the extra payment. Consecutive is defined by the interval value indicated in the PmtKey object.

Returns:
int

getAmount

double getAmount()
Gets the amount of the extra payment.

Returns:
double

setPmtKey

ExtraPmt setPmtKey(PmtKey pmtKey)
Sets the PmtKey instance. This method encourages immutability by returning an instance of ExtraPmt. The object returned will use the specified PmtKey instance and will have the same count and amount values as the object on which setPmtKey was called.

Parameters:
pmtKey - PmtKey instance
Returns:
ExtraPmt instantiation

setCount

ExtraPmt setCount(int count)
Sets the count. This method encourages immutability by returning an instance of ExtraPmt. The object returned will use the specified count and will have the same ExtraPmt instance and amount values as the object on which setCount was called.

Parameters:
count - The count value
Returns:
ExtraPmt instantiation

setAmount

ExtraPmt setAmount(double amount)
Sets the amount. This method encourages immutability by returning an instance of ExtraPmt. The object returned will use the specified amount and will have the same ExtraPmt instance and count values as the object on which setAmount was called.

Parameters:
amount - The amount value
Returns:
ExtraPmt instantiation
